intro: Crepis triasii, commonly known as the Triassic hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, linear leaves. Its flowers are yellow with pale purple centers, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Crepis triasii is a perennial herb that is relatively uncommon in cultivation.
